oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Fortune Feeds - 1952-07-05
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Parts 1 and 2 of Fortune Feeds sponsored Grand Ole Opry show from July 5, 1952. Hosted by Carl Smith.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Grant Turner; Carl Smith; Hank Williams; June Carter; Anita Carter; Ray Price; Possum Hunters; Tommy Sosebee; Jordanaires
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Grant Turner introduces the Fortune Feed Grand Ole Opry Show -- (00:06) Martha White Theme [featuring Grant Turner voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (00:45) It's a Lovely, Lovely World (Carl Smith) -- ( 02:58) Carl Smith discusses the upcoming show and introduces Hank Williams -- (03:26) Long Gone Lonesome Blues (Hank Williams) -- (06:13) Smith introduces June Carter -- (06:18) Chicken Reel (June Carter) -- (06:33) Smith performs a Fortune Feeds radio spot -- (07:50) Fortune Feeds Theme (June Carter) -- (08:00) Smith introduces Anita Carter -- (08:12) Anything That's Part of You (Anita Carter) -- (11:07) Smith introduces Ray Price -- (11:35) Talk to Your Heart (Ray Price) -- (14:04) Smith performs a Martha White radio spot while inviting the audience to join in a dance -- (14:25) Scruggs Rag (Possum Hunters) -- (16:06) Smith introduces Tommy Sosebee -- (16:31) Many Miles (Tommy Sosebee) -- (18:30) Smith introduces the Jordanaires -- (18:45) Working on a Building (Jordanaires) -- (20:15) Smith discusses playing a tune of his own (20:27) Are You Teasing Me (Carl Smith) -- (22:51) Grant Turner performs a Fortune Feed radio spot -- (24:19) Smith introduces Hank Williams -- (24:41) Window Shopping (Hank Williams) -- (27:46) Smith performs his outro statements -- (28:18) Fortune Feeds Theme (June Carter)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Turner, Grant; Smith, Carl; Smith, Carl, 1927-2010; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953. I saw the light; Carter Cash, June; Carter, Anita; Carter, Anita, 1933-1999; Carter, June; Price, Ray, 1926-2013; Possum Hunters (Musical group); Sosebee, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group);
